result.execSummary:
The defendant Jaswant Singh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Mistreatment of Animals/Cause Death [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Hearing 4/14/2015.
***5-8-2015, Judge Flanagan; Court ordered Defendant agrees to pay $1,597.24, as restitution to Sharon Dull; $250.00 as restitution to the Milwaukee Area Domestic Animal Control Commission (MADACC); and $20.50, as restitution to the Milwaukee County District Attorney's Office.  The total restitution figure is $1,867.74.

Pay  DNA surcharge, all applicable costs and surcharges, victim witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge and supervision fees as determined by DOC during period of Extended Supervision or civil judgment.
**12-13-16 Court ordered domestic abuse surcharge vacated.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medications.

No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with victim Sharon D. or any animals.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling and continue programming.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests. Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Defendant is not an eligible voter.
____________
Per Statute 951.18(4)(c) -for a period of five (5) years the defendant is not allowed to own, possess, train any animal; and not reside in a home with animals.

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT: The Defendant pay $1,597.24, as restitution to Sharon Dull; $250.00, as resitution to the Milwaukee Area Domestic Animal Control Commission (MADACC); and $20.50, as restitution to the Milwaukee County District Attorney's Office.  The total restitution figure is $1,867.74.
Order, signed and filed.   mld

The State, by Assistant District Attorney Kristen Schrank, and the defendant, by his attorney, Attorney Christopher Ertl, hereby stipulate as follows:
- The Defendant agrees to pay $1,597.24, as restitution to Sharon Dull; $250.00 as restitution to the Milwaukee Area Domestic Animal Control Commission (MADACC); and $20.50, as restitution to the Milwaukee County District Attorney's Office.  The total restitution figure is $1,867.74.   mld

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Jaswant Singh not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is in custody and was not produced.  All parties stipulated to the following restitution: Court ordered defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $1,597.24 to the victim, Sharon D., $250.00 to the Milwaukee Area Domestic Animal Control Commission and $20.50 to the Milwaukee County Distric Attorney's Office, for a total restitution due in the amount of $1,867.74.  Restitution to be paid as a condition of extended supervision, and if not paid, a CIVIL JUDGMENT to issue.  

Court ordered that any cash bail on either case 2014CF487 and 2014CF3137 should be applied first to the restitution amount due, then the fees and costs.   mld

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Jaswant Singh not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a jury trial.  Victim appears.  Matter rescheduled for a restitution hearing.  Restitution hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COPY OF NOTICE OF INTENT, court record sheet and judgment of conviction forwarded to the State Public Defender's Office in Madison.

records.addlTxt: Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING commencing 03/20/2015 received and filed. (53 Pages.)

Defendant Jaswant Singh in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Sharon D. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE to case 2014CF3137), with credit for 7 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Sharon D., or any animals.   
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, during period of 
   Extended Supervision or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the 
   Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
* Restitution hearing scheduled for 4-14-2015 at 8:30 am. 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. 
*** Defendant is not an eligible voter.   
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Memorandum of Extended Supervision.  
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
PER STATUTE: 951.18(4)(c) - for a period of 5 years, the defendant is not allowed to own, possess, train any animal and not reside in a home with animals.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Jaswant Singh in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #2, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #1 (as charged): Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 3-20-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail, including no contact with Sharon D., continue supervision with Justice Point Supervision, and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.  mld

Defendant Jaswant Singh in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.   Due to the congestion of the calendar, and the defendant scheduled for several doctor appointments, following surgery, Court ordered case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 1-28-2015 at 8:30 am.  Plea paperwork in file.  All conditions of bail are continued until further order of the Court.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Court ordered that defendant, tomorrow morning (1-22-2015), should go directly to Justice Point at 8:00 am, for removal of his gps bracelet, then go straight to hospital for  surgical procedure, then return directly to Justice Point to have his gps bracelet reattached.   mld

Defendant Jaswant Singh in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Letter from physician of defendant was presented to the Court from defense counsel.  Court heard and granted defense motion to modify release conditions of gps supervision to allow defendant to have a surgical procedure conducted on 1-22-2015.  The State was opposed to defense motion.    mld

Defendant Jaswant Singh in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defense Moves to Adjourn the Jury Trial.  Defense declines the offer of the State.  The State declines the counter-offer by defense.  The State is currently waiting for a fingerprint card from Interpol.  The Court heard and grants defense one further adjournment of the Jury Trial.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 1-26-2015 at 8:30 am.  Trial will go forward without information (fingerprint card), on next date, per the Court.  Defense counsel to respond to the State's Other Acts Motion before the end of the year.  All conditions of bail are continued, in full force, per Order of the Court.  mld

Defendant Jaswant Singh in court with attorney Christopher J Ertl.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
